docs.title: DungeonsHub
docs.text:
Welcome to DungeonsHub

Your central hub for Minecraft Dungeons mastery. From beginner basics to advanced strategies, discover comprehensive guides created by the community's best players.

Featuring 391 expert guides crafted by 6 amazing contributors

🎮 Guide Creators

Learn from the experts who've mastered every aspect of the game

Agenciak's Guides

Comprehensive beginner-friendly guides covering melee combat, rolling mechanics, and powerful builds.

BusterCat's Guides

Expert strategies and powerful builds to maximize your efficiency and dominate the dungeons.

GrimReaper's Guides

Creative collection: 262 themed builds inspired by pop culture, mythology, and legends. Fun, roleplay-focused strategies—not meta builds.

Pancake's Guides

Creative builds and unique strategies offering fresh perspectives and innovative solutions.

Shin's Guides

Massive collection: 98 guides covering mechanics, all 53 melee weapons, and all 35 armor sets. Complete system analysis with data-driven insights.

💬 Reddit Guides

Community-curated guides from the Minecraft Dungeons subreddit. Learn from the best players.

🔗 Other Sources

Additional resources, tools, and guides from around the web. Calculators, wikis, and more!

✨ What You'll Find Here

Comprehensive resources to elevate your gameplay

⚔️ Combat Strategies

Master melee and ranged combat techniques with detailed breakdowns and practical tips

🎯 Build Optimization

Create powerful synergistic builds that maximize damage and survivability

📊 Tier Lists

Best weapons, armor, and artifacts ranked by performance and utility

🗺️ Level Walkthroughs

Complete guides for every level with secrets, strategies, and boss tactics

💎 Enchantment Guides

Optimize your enchantment choices for maximum effectiveness

🏆 Endgame Content

Conquer Apocalypse+ difficulty with proven strategies and builds

🚀 Quick Start Guide

Not sure where to begin? We'll point you in the right direction

🌱 New Players

Start with Agenciak's Guides for beginner-friendly content covering the fundamentals of combat and builds.

🎨 Creative Strategists

Check out BusterCat's or Pancake's Guides for unique and innovative approaches to the game.

🧠 Understanding Mechanics

Dive into Shin's Guides to learn how the game actually works—enchantment scaling, AI behavior, and why builds succeed or fail.

⚡ Power Builds

GrimReaper's Guides feature devastating builds focused on soul power and dark arts.

🔥 Featured Guides

Popular guides to get you started

⚔️ Melee Combat Guide

Learn weapon types, enchantment synergies, and combat strategies for beginners.

💨 Rolling Mechanics Guide

Master the art of constant rolling with Burstbowstring and Cooldown Shot. Understanding i-frames and defensive tactics.

🎃 Halloween Stings Build

A dark Halloween-themed build featuring soul-based powers and devastating attacks.

Ready to Begin Your Adventure?

Choose a guide section above and start your journey to becoming a Dungeons master!

Start Learning

docs.title: 🛡️ Agenciak's Guides
docs.text: Welcome to beginner-friendly guides! Perfect for players starting their journey through Minecraft Dungeons.

docs.title: 📚 Available Guides
docs.text:
⚔️ Melee Combat Guide

Learn the fundamentals of melee combat, weapon types, and basic strategies for beginners.

💨 Rolling Mechanics Guide

Master the art of rolling and dodging to survive the toughest battles with i-frames!

✨ Enchantments Compendium

Everything about enchantments in Minecraft Dungeons. Detailed breakdown of melee, armor, and ranged enchantments.

📖 Glossary

Useful terms and definitions explained in detail. Learn about DR, EHP, damage types, and more!

docs.title: 💡 What You'll Learn
docs.text:
⚔️ Combat Basics

Understanding weapon mechanics, attack patterns, and damage optimization

🛡️ Defense Tactics

When to block, dodge, or run. Master defensive mechanics to survive

💪 Power Progression

Building your character effectively from start to endgame

🎯 Enemy Patterns

Recognizing and countering threats before they overwhelm you

About These Guides

All guides are written with beginners in mind. Take your time, practice the techniques, and soon you'll be ready for higher difficulties! 🎮✨

Choose a guide above to begin your journey!

docs.title: Compendium - Enchantments
docs.text: Here you will find everything about enchantments in Minecraft Dungeons

docs.title: Void Strike
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DPS

Applies a damage multiplier that grows over time, this means that it's considerably better on slower weapons. The buff ranges from +25% on very fast weapons up to +175% on very slow ones.

Uses: - Every weapon faster or as fast as a tempest knife receives over +40% DPS, which outclasses every other DPS booster when it comes to all enemies. - Some builds utilize void strike along with jungle poison, due to the latter not taking it off when dealing damage, which leads to very high damage output

docs.title: Unchanting
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DPS

+100% physical damage against enchanted mobs

Uses: - Very helpful in higher difficulties when enchanted mobs are very numerous and the most dangerous, a good choice for every weapon.

docs.title: Leeching
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: HEALING

Every mob killed with physical damage heals you for 9% of it's max health

Uses: - Builds that don't rely too much on indirect damage (which "steals" kills from leeching) can use leeching as a subside for the lifesteal aura, it's healing is better than radiance but needs kills to trigger, which can sometimes make it unreliable.

docs.title: Radiance
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: HEALING

Every hit has a 20% chance to trigger healing

Uses: - A healing alternative that does not need physical damage to activate, matches leeching on faster weapons.

docs.title: Guarding Strike
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DEFENSE

Each physical damage kill grants 50% DR as a player status effect (which means that it doesn't diminish with other DR sources)

Uses: - Reliable non-diminishing DR source, works well as long as there is not too much indirect damage

docs.title: Weakening
docs.text:
RANK: S TYPE: DEFENSE

Hitting an enemy with physical damageinflicts a status effect reducing their damage by 40% (which translates to 40% player DR against affected mobs), diminishes with the gong of weakening (since they're both mob debuffs)

Uses: - All weapons with good AoE benefit from weakening, as long as they don't oneshot most of the enemies (like rolling build anchors)

docs.title: Glossary
docs.text: Here you will find useful terms and definitions explained in detail

docs.title: DEFENSE
docs.text:
Damage Reduction (DR) - the percentage value by which received damage is reduced (you can find specific DR values in the compendium) - formula: DR=1-1/EHP - example: 100 damage taken with 20% DR turns into 80 damage

Damage Negation (DN) - the chance of fully negating received damage - example: 100 damage taken with 30% DN gives a 30% chance of the damage "missing"

mob debuff DR - status effect inflicted on a mob that reduces it's DPS, calculated in DR and does not diminish with DR sources different than other mob debuffs

Effective Health Points (EHP) - modifier used to convert health increase into DR or vice versa - formula: EHP=1x2(DR/1-DR) - example: 50% DR is 2x EHP, which means that twice as much damage has to be taken for the health loss to be proportional

docs.title: DAMAGE
docs.text:
Physical damage - damage dealt by melee or ranged weapon hits, influenced by enchants like unchanting, critical hit or committed

Flat physical damage modifier - buffs that apply a physical damage multiplier to the base damage without interacting with each other, which means that they're first added together and then the damage is multiplied by the total - examples: reckless, overcharge, shadow form, all built-in armor damage buffs

Indirect damage - non-physical damage that does not activate enchants like guarding strike or leeching on kill, some of them get buffed by elemental focuses (poison, lightning, fire, soul) - examples: shockwave, exploding, all elemental damage

Full damage multipliers (mob debuffs) - status effects inflicted on mobs that cause them to receive greater damage - examples: gong of weakening, void strike

docs.title: MISCELLANEOUS
docs.text:
3-6 +25 trial - refers to tier III daily trial with 6 collected banner modifiers (3 threat and 3 mystery, obtained from raid captains found in some missions) on the difficulty apocalypse +25 (the max base difficulty), the hardest possible (un-modded) difficulty

META - Most Effective Tactic Available, is a very controversial term, due to just how many different build types there are. It's impossible to effectively compare a rolling build with a melee build - this causes common misuse, but the most common interpretation is that something is META if it can beat a 3-6 +25 trial

docs.title: Melee weapon
docs.text: Best weapon options for melee-focused builds, there is a lot of strong weapons but these are the most commonly used, i also added some good enchant combos

docs.title: Double Axe,  Whirlwind
docs.text:
Solid DPS paired with big area, often called the best melee weapon

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Starless Night
docs.text:
5th highest DPS in the game, big area and has Shared Pain built in

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Obsidian Claymore
docs.text:
3rd highest DPS in the game paired with big area make this weapon really strong

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Master's Katana
docs.text:
6th highest DPS in the game, solid attack area, can run Pain cycle really well because of it's combo lenght

+ / + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ / + +

docs.title: Bone Cudgel,  Boneclub
docs.text:
7th highest DPS, big attack area

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Nameless Blade
docs.text:
10th highest DPS, built in helps this weapon a lot

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

docs.title: Growing Staff
docs.text:
11th highest DPS, Committed is built in, can use Gravity (it's attack area isn't that big, so it requires something to boost it), but also works without it

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

+ + +

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

docs.title: Bee Stinger,  Rapier,  Freezing Foil
docs.text:
Very fast hits, long reach, small area (requires Gravity), because of common Thundering use it gets buffed by Lightning focus a lot

+ + +

+ + +

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

docs.title: Fighter's Bindings
docs.text:
Very fast with a short combo and small area, because of common Thundering use it gets buffed by Lightning focus a lot (This weapon has over 20 "good!!!" combinations, i'm not gonna list them all, the subjectively best ones are the following)

+ + +

+ + + ( Ambush gives you a +60% DPS buff to enemies stunned by Stunning, making them a very effective combo for fast weapons)

+ + + (Only with lifesteal)

+ + +

docs.title: Armor
docs.text: Best armor options for melee-focused builds

docs.title: Wither Armor
docs.text:
• Lifesteal aura (heals you for 6% of your weapon's direct damage (so enchants like Shockwave, Swirling or Thundering don't fuel it, if you're using lifesteal armor, these are the enchants you want to avoid, also it's an aura, meaning that your allies also benefit from it)
  • +35% Damage reduction

docs.title: Spider Armor
docs.text:
• Lifesteal aura
  • +25% faster attack speed

docs.title: Renegade Armor
docs.text:
• +20% weapon damage boost aura
  • +25% faster attack speed
  • +35% damage reduction

Enchantments

Cooldown - mandatory, allows for infinite deathcap mushroom and iron hide amulet at high power levels

Potion barrier - very good, gives you 90% DR for 9 seconds every time your health potion is used, very strong when paired with Refreshment

Deflecting - very good, has a 45% to block 100% damage from incoming projectiles and deflect them to their source

Chilling - very good, slows enemies (Triggers every 2 seconds)

Snowball - very good, stuns one enemy for 1 second every second (it can save you in close meetings with creepers)

Death barter - good, allows you to respawn with 100% health, the downside of it is that discards everything you earned during the mission, it's not the best possible option for builds focusing on not dying at all (melee/tank builds)

Cowardice - good, if you have full HP, you deal 40% more damage, melee builds take a lot of damage but with solid healing it's a good DPS booster

Surprise gift - only in specific builds, you have 50% chance to create a random consumable item, but that also could be used by itself, but combined with Refreshment it can be really helpful, often used alongside Potion Barrier in health potion spam builds

Reckless - only in specific builds, you have 40% less HP, but deal 90% more damage, it should be used only in builds with a lot of damage reduction

docs.title: Ranged Weapons
docs.text: Your ranged weapon doesn't really matter in melee builds, you could preferably use a one-shot bow (elite power bow with enchants like + + ) to easily clear out stronger enemies or an imploding crossbow with Refreshment to utilise potion enchants like barrier more effectively

docs.title: What is a "rolling build"?
docs.text:
The core of it being rolling build is Burstbowstring paired with Cooldown shot and a Light feather, how does it work? Burstbowstring triggers every time you roll, shooting out 1 fully charged arrow per enemy (up to 3 arrows), each of them triggers Cooldownshot speeding up your artifact cooldown 1.5s per charged shot, Light feather has a 3s cooldown, which means that you get to roll constantly shooting 3 charged arrows (which shortens your cooldown by 4.5s, allowing for a second roll using the feather right after) every time you do it with the only condition being close to at least 2 enemies

Remember that you need a ton of arrows for it to work, that's why you need Looting or Infinity

docs.title: Ranged Weapon
docs.text: Best options for a rolling bow

docs.title: Winter's Touch
docs.text:
If your build uses any quiver artifacts, this is what you're looking for

  • Shoots out 3 arrows when charged (In a rolling build it means 9 arrows for every roll, because 3 arrows per 1 shot and Burstbowstring provides 3 shots)
  • Slows down hit enemies

docs.title: Pink Scoundrel
docs.text:
• ricochets after hitting an enemy
  • has a chance to "enrage" mobs (makes them attack everything instead of focusing on the player, other enemies, passive animals but still can target players)

docs.title: Bubble Burster
docs.text:
• ricochets after hitting an enemy
  • traps enemies in bubbles

docs.title: Enchantments
docs.text:
Burstbowstring - mandatory

Cooldown shot - mandatory

Infinity - if you use quivers, has a chance to not use up your arrow

Looting - if you don't use quivers,

Multishot - if you use Winter's touch, has a 40% to turn each arrow you shoot out into 5 projectiles, it's very effective on Winter's touch, because it shoots out 3 arrows (meaning each of them has a 40% chance for it activate)

Tempo theft - good, slows down enemies and speeds you up

Wild rage - good, enrages mobs

Voidstrike shot - good, applies a damage multiplier, weaker than melee Voidstrike (added)

docs.title: Melee weapon
docs.text: You can exploit the fact that you constantly roll by using weapons with "jungle poison" transfer their damage into the poison, paired with which makes the poison deal up to 600% damage you are able to oneshot most bosses easily

docs.title: Encrusted Anchor
docs.text:
Very high damage and area

+ + / + / / /

docs.title: Vine Whip
docs.text:
Long reach, high damage

+ + + / / /

docs.title: Armor
docs.text: Best armor choices for a rolling build

docs.title: Shadow Walker
docs.text:
For normal rolling

  • invulnerability while rolling
  • +35% damage reduction
  • -50% rolling cooldown

+ + / / + ( Lightning focus only with Thundering Quiver or Satchel of Elements)

docs.title: Glow Squid Armor
docs.text:
For normal rolling

  • invulnerability while rolling
  • +15% movespeed aura
  • shoots out ink, making enemies miss some hits

+ + / / + ( Lightning focus only with Thundering Quiver or Satchel of Elements)

docs.title: Splendid Robe
docs.text:
For artifact spam

  • +40% artifact cooldown
  • +30% melee damage
  • +50% artifact damage

+ + +

docs.title: 🔄 Armor Swapping Guide
docs.text: 📺 Video Tutorial: Watch this video

docs.title: 🎯 How to Do It:
docs.text:
• 📦 Have the heros/mystery armor at the top of your inventory to switch to faster
  • 💊 When using a health potion:
  • ⚡ Switch to the armor
  • 🍷 Use health potion
  • 🔙 Switch back to the main armor

docs.title: 🎯 What is Move-Attacking?
docs.text: Move-attacking is an advanced technique that allows you to move around while using the anchor weapon. This technique is essential for maintaining mobility during combat while still dealing damage.

docs.title: 🎮 How to Move-Attack with the Anchor
For the Host Player
docs.text:
Step-by-step process:

  1. Hold the melee attack button
  2. Click light feather milliseconds after (ideally)
  3. Let go of the attack button mid-air or before you touch the ground
  4. You can now move around or dodge projectiles while waiting for the anchor to land

Requirements: - At least 2 mobs nearby - Burst Bowstring enchantment - Light Feather artifact

docs.title: For Non-Host Players
docs.text:
If you aren't the host, the timing is different:

  1. Click the melee button
  2. Use feather right after
  3. No need for Burst Bowstring or even a feather for basic movement

docs.title: 💡 Tips & Tricks
docs.text:
Timing is Everything

The key to successful move-attacking is the timing between clicking the melee button and activating the light feather. Practice the timing in lower difficulties first!

Host vs Non-Host

The technique works differently depending on whether you're hosting the game or joining someone else's game. Make sure to practice both methods!

Mob Requirements

For hosts, you need at least 2 mobs nearby with burst bowstring to execute this technique properly. Plan your positioning accordingly!

docs.title: 📊 Comparison Notes
docs.text:
For comparison: A tier 3 daily trial, 25 apocalypse using 251 power level with these modifiers: 200% mob damage, 200% mob health, and 3× threat has 11.4× mob damage/health. (3.814 × 3.)

Many of these builds have other benefits like high movespeed. For builds beyond, you'll be better off looking beyond just survivability!

Build Testing

These builds have been tested in extreme conditions. The mob damage multipliers shown represent the maximum tested survivability under various scenarios.

About the Numbers

The damage multipliers (e.g., 168×, 65×) indicate how much mob damage these builds can handle compared to base game difficulty. Higher numbers mean better survivability!

docs.title: Enchantment Tierlist
docs.text:
Based on the best uses the enchantments have, and in general.

For example, chilling reduces mob speed while snowball stuns mobs but can also activate ambush, and fight one mob at a time so it has better uses on some builds.

docs.title: Artifact Tierlist
docs.text: Mostly based on the best uses artifacts can get. (In my opinion, though I haven't tried everything.)

docs.title: Bow Enchantment Tierlist
docs.text:
Based on best uses the enchantments have, and in general.

For example, ricochet is great for many builds but radiance shot is above it because on few builds it gives much more radiance than fighter bindings with mushroom even.

docs.title: Armor Tierlist
docs.text: Based on the best uses armors have. For example, the best builds and how many builds it is good on. Rolling builds are usually better, and I value damage reduction a lot.

docs.title: 💀 GrimReaper's Guides
docs.text: The Dark Side of Minecraft Dungeons

docs.title: 💀 Philosophy
docs.text: These are creatively themed builds inspired by characters, stories, and legends. They're designed for fun and roleplay, not necessarily for optimal performance or meta strategies. Each build tells a story!

docs.title: 📚 Featured Build
docs.text:
🎃 Halloween Stings Build

By the shrieks from its wings! A dark Halloween-themed build featuring the Spooky Gourdian, Corrupted Pumpkin, and soul-based powers.

docs.title: 💀 The Warden of the Gates of Hell
💀 The Guardian of the Rotten Forest
💀 The Spirit and the Three Lost Souls

💀 Baba Yaga and the Son of the Corrupted Cauldron

💀 The Dwarf King and his Army of Iron Golems
💀 The Crimson Cult and the Eldritch Guardians
💀 The Ghostly Janitor of Highblock Castle
💀 The Mischievous and Volatile Goblin of Destruction
💀 The Dark Knights of Veznans Army
🎃 Halloween Stings By The Shrieks From Its Wings
📜 The Story of Halloween
docs.text:
Halloween gets its name, from the demons that played a game. A game that had sacrifices with song, songs that would bring monsters along.

The monsters would then circle around a camp, monsters like skeletons, werewolves and vamps. They would chant a great song for their lord, so that he would rise and kill the humans with his sword.

Upon his back were huge wings, wings that would also sing. They shrieked out a fine tune that made ears bleed, all that was good would die and sprout the seeds...

The seeds of the great pumpkins that grew on Halloween, the pumpkins that would grow from organs like the spleen. Pumpkins that would grow and give birth to great power, power that would shoot out of their flowers.

There would also be clouds of pollen that was created, to trick the humans and keep them separated. All of this was done on Halloween, for evil needs to rise and wipe the Earth clean.

docs.title: 💡 Build Notes
docs.text:
This Halloween-themed build focuses on dark, spooky aesthetics combined with powerful soul and elemental damage synergies. The build uses the Corrupted Pumpkin and Shock Powder artifacts to create devastating area effects while maintaining a terrifying presence on the battlefield.

Dark Power

This build embraces the chaos of Halloween! Master the shrieking attacks and pumpkin powers to overwhelm your enemies! 💀🎃

docs.title: Pain Cycle damage boost on weapons.
docs.text:
Assuming it stays lined up to trigger on the last hit of the combo.

Pain Cycle is additive so it scales badly with things like sharpness or strength adding the percentages together instead of multiplying each other.

Katana: 84.7%

Mace: 103.7%

Spear: 90.9% (Whispering Spear will off-set it due to the echo)

Starless Night: 87.3%

docs.title: 📊 Spear Info
docs.text: / / are all incredible weapons with the highest reach in game allowing you to keep mobs at bay with for some of the highest survivability in game.

docs.title: Best unique:
docs.text: is the best unique in the line, although it's just it does help with the pushback of the weapon allowing it to keep mobs away slightly better though Spear is great from simply being Spear.

docs.title: Playstyle:
docs.text: You use Spears by utilizing the reach keeping a distance from mobs as much as you can, you hide behind cover and walls to put them in-between you and the enemy, doing this will keep any knockback able mob away but if you’re facing a threat not pushed back you move with the mob keeping it at the edge of your reach and yourself out of their reach.

docs.title: Best Enchants:
docs.text:
is the entire core of the weapon, it singlehandedly puts it up multiple tiers by allowing it to group up and keep mobs at bay as it pulls mobs into the impact of your weapon, this also helps the AoE area.

is the best damage enchant for it being 98.6% extra dps at base 86.3% extra dps with MAS, 56.3% extra dps with , and 48.1% extra dps with and MAS. (MAS refers to the armor perk +25% Melee Attack Speed) (This does not include the first hit which applies ).

Though adding the speed from and MAS help perform better with more pushback and is more dps overall.

is the next best damage enchant if you're on Apoc+ especially higher ones as it's 100% extra dps so enchanted mobs, your biggest threat on the difficulty.

is 40% extra dps overall, though it can overkill and matter less Spear doesn't suffer enough to invalidate it.

is basically a sidegrade to not activating on the first hit but being more consistent on following hits, it's about 35%-40% dps itself so overkill included on they do about the same, more to a boss.

is simply 9% of your dps as healing after you kill a mob, although the weapon is defensive enough to be able to pass with even a tranged this is what you'd use if you need melee healing.

is simply just 50% damage reduction for 4 seconds upon a kill always halving the damage you take. Spear is already defensive but this can help when things go bad or against ranged mobs which can hit you or which will damage you for melee damage done.

docs.title: Honorable mentions/still solid Enchants:
docs.text:
upon kill mobs will explode for 60% of their health as damage, with Spear groups melts up into an area so this can hit multiple mobs, it also has knockback which can further help keep them at bay though the knockback Spear already has can make it less predictable in where will go.

is 40% direct damage reduction to whatever you hit and it is nearly a hit for 5 seconds. Spear groups up mobs so this will all hit a lot though it doesn't against , , etc damage.

reduces your Potion cooldown by 3 seconds upon kill, Spear isn't a beatstick large area melee so it doesn't benefit as much as something that can kill faster would but with //Potion Coolwon it wouldn't be the worst.

if lined up to land on the final hit in every other combo will be 90.0% extra dps however if it gets misaligned the dps will instead be 54.5%, with will also misalign it by itself and the boost is additive meaning it only stacks by adding together rather than multiplying by the percent like the others mentioned

also takes away 3% health every activation hit (doesn't for the actual hit, 2.5% health on average per attack) so will take up some of your healing.

docs.title: 🧠 Teaching Philosophy
docs.text:
Shin's guides focus on game understanding rather than just build lists. The goal is simple: turn you from a guide-follower into someone who understands the system.

Instead of just telling you "use this build," Shin explains: - Why enchantments work the way they do - How damage scaling actually functions - What makes a build Apocalypse-ready

docs.title: 🌉 The Bridge Between Beginner and Intermediate
docs.text:
You've learned the basics from other guides, but now you want to know:

  • Why does this enchantment combo work?
  • How do I adapt builds instead of just copying them?
  • What happens when I change difficulty levels?

That's where Shin's content shines.

Perfect For Players Who Want to Understand

If you've been copying builds without knowing why they work, Shin's guides will transform how you approach the game. Less memorization, more understanding.

From Guide-Follower to System-Understander

⭐ Weapons Guide
docs.text: In-Depth Weapon Analysis & Star Rating System

docs.title: 📖 About These Guides
docs.text:
This collection features comprehensive weapon analysis guides with detailed numerical stats and a star rating system. Each guide includes:

  • Numerical stats for every weapon
  • Star ratings across multiple categories
  • Detailed mechanics breakdown
  • Enchantment interactions and how they affect performance
  • Recommended enchant combinations based on data

docs.title: ⭐ Star Rating System
docs.text: All weapons are evaluated using a consistent 5-star rating system across four key metrics:

docs.title: 🗡️ Hits Per Second (HPS)
docs.text: Stars HPS Value ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ 15 HPS ⭐⭐⭐⭐✨ 13.5 HPS ⭐⭐⭐⭐ 12 HPS ⭐⭐⭐✨ 10.5 HPS ⭐⭐⭐ 9 HPS ⭐⭐✨ 7.5 HPS ⭐⭐ 6 HPS ⭐✨ 4.5 HPS ⭐ 3 HPS ✨ 1.5 HPS

docs.title: 📏 Reach
docs.text: Stars Distance (blocks in-between) ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ 7 blocks ⭐⭐⭐⭐✨ 6.4 blocks ⭐⭐⭐⭐ 5.8 blocks ⭐⭐⭐✨ 5.2 blocks ⭐⭐⭐ 4.6 blocks ⭐⭐✨ 4 blocks ⭐⭐ 3.4 blocks ⭐✨ 2.8 blocks ⭐ 2.2 blocks ✨ 1.6 blocks

docs.title: 🔬 Methodology
docs.text:
Every measurement has been meticulously tested and recorded:

  • ✅ HPS values tested across all weapons
  • ✅ DPS calculations based on controlled testing environments
  • ✅ Reach measurements precisely measured for each weapon
  • ✅ Area coverage measured in degrees for hit detection

docs.title: 📚 Individual Weapon Guides
docs.text:
Browse the weapon-specific guides below to see detailed analysis, enchantment recommendations, and complete stat breakdowns for each weapon.

Data-Driven Analysis

These ratings are based on extensive testing and measurement. Use them as a foundation to understand weapon capabilities and build optimal setups.

Comprehensive weapon analysis for informed build decisions
